metadata.title: Daily Routines - Intermediate Level (5ª série)
metadata.description: Quiz de 50 questões sobre rotinas diárias em inglês: get dressed, get up, go to school, play with friends, do homework, take a shower, go to bed, come home.
metadata.subject: Inglês

content.introduction: This quiz focuses on daily routine expressions in English. You'll practice vocabulary, sentence structure, and understanding when we do different activities during the day.
instructions: Choose the best answer for each question.
Think about the meaning and context of daily routine expressions.
There are 50 questions to practice your English skills.

questions.question: What does 'get up' mean?
options: Wake up and leave the bed

questions.question: Which phrase means 'to put on your clothes'?
What do you do when you 'take a shower'?
'Come home' means:
When you 'do your homework', you:
I _____ at 7 o'clock every morning.
After I get up, I _____ and brush my teeth.
She _____ before breakfast.
We _____ at 8:30 in the morning.
They _____ in the afternoon, after school.
I _____ at 3:30 p.m. from school.
He _____ every evening before dinner.
My sister _____ at 9 p.m. because she's tired.
We _____ together at the park on weekends.
Maria _____ quickly because she's late.
What do you do FIRST in the morning?
What is the correct order? 1. ___ 2. Get dressed 3. Go to school
After school, what do most students do FIRST?
What do you usually do BEFORE going to bed?
What is the LAST thing you do at night?
What time do you get up?
options: I go to school at 8 a.m.
I go to bed at 9 p.m.

questions.question: When do you go to school?
What do you do after school?
options: I come home and do my homework

questions.question: Do you play with your friends every day?
When do you take a shower?
options: In the morning or before bed

questions.question: It's 6:30 a.m. and your alarm clock rings. What do you do?
You just woke up and you're still in pajamas. What should you do next?
School is finished. It's 3 p.m. What do you do?
Your teacher gave you exercises to complete at home. What do you need to do?
It's Saturday afternoon and you're free. You want to have fun. What might you do?
Choose the correct sentence:
options: She is get up at 7 a.m.

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence:
options: They goes to school by bus.
They go to school by bus.
They going to school by bus.
They is go to school by bus.

questions.question: What is the negative form? 'I go to bed early.'
options: I not go to bed early.
I don't go to bed early.
I doesn't go to bed early.
I am not go to bed early.

questions.question: What is the question form? 'He takes a shower.'
My brother _____ his homework before dinner.
I _____ get up early on weekends.
She _____ plays with friends after school.
How often do you do your homework?
options: All answers are possible depending on the student

questions.question: We _____ go to school on Sundays.
Do you _____ take a shower in the morning?
Read: 'Tom gets up at 6:30. He takes a shower and gets dressed. Then he goes to school.' What does Tom do AFTER taking a shower?
Read: 'Mary comes home at 4 p.m. She does her homework and then plays with friends.' When does Mary play with friends?
Read: 'On weekdays, I go to bed at 9 p.m. On weekends, I go to bed at 10 p.m.' When do I sleep later?
Read: 'After school, Jake comes home and takes a shower. Then he does his homework.' What does Jake do FIRST after school?
Read: 'Lisa gets dressed, eats breakfast, and goes to school.' What is the correct order?
What's another way to say 'I return home'?
Which is NOT a morning activity?
Complete the routine: Get up → _____ → Get dressed → Go to school
What do you say when someone asks 'What do you do after dinner?'
options: I do my homework or watch TV

questions.question: Choose the sentence that makes sense:
options: I go to bed in the morning
I go to school before I get up
